thread.title: 'Lifted spirits' as Lamar Odom progresses

author: Martin Rogers, USA TODAY Sports
title: 'Lifted spirits' as Lamar Odom progresses
text:
'Lifted spirits' as Lamar Odom progresses USA Today Sports 5 hrs ago by Martin Rogers, USA TODAY Sports Lamar Odom’s continued recovery from his life-threatening collapse last week has significantly “lifted spirits” at the Las Vegas hospital where he is being treated, a person with knowledge of the situation told USA TODAY Sports on Monday.
AdChoices The person asked not to be named due to the sensitivity of the matter.
According to the source, Odom made solid progress over the weekend and while still in intensive care, had been able to communicate with doctors and loved ones, had spent some time out of his bed resting in an armchair and was responsive to comments from visitors.
“There is more optimism and a different vibe,” the person said. “There are lifted spirits now.”
Furthermore, the initial restrictions placed upon other patients and their family members in the vicinity of Odom’s room at the Sunrise Hospital and Medical Center, a few miles from the Las Vegas Strip, had largely been lifted.
In the days after Odom was transported to the hospital last Tuesday, the families of other patients on the ward were asked to stay clear of the area close to where Odom was being kept.
It is understood that Odom now has few restrictions on receiving visitors and is breathing on his own. However, doctors remained concerned that he is allowed sufficient rest for his healing to continue. His estranged wife Khloe Kardashian remained at the facility as of Monday afternoon and was corresponding with some of Odom’s friends.
Odom, a former NBA Sixth Man of the Year and two-time world champion with the Los Angeles Lakers, was found unresponsive at a Nevada brothel called the Love Ranch last Tuesday, following a three-day stay at the establishment. Police were told that he had used cocaine and sexual enhancement supplements in the preceding days.
A report that Odom may be transported to Los Angeles to further his rehabilitation could not be confirmed by USA TODAY Sports. However, the source stated that there was “zero chance” of the 35-year-old being moved until doctors were certain that moving him would not be a source of stress or discomfort.
